name: European Esperanto Union
membership: ECSPM/European Civil Society Platform for Multilingualism
memberOrga: www.europo.eu  - The national Esperanto associations of all 28 EU Member States.  Natural persons are not members of EEU, only national Esperanto associations in EU Member States.
goal:
1. The promotion of multilingualism and linguistic justice in Europe, by using the international language, Esperanto.
2. Sensitizing the EU institutions to the importance of language policy in bringing the citizen closer to European integration.
3. Coordinating the activities of the national Esperanto associations in all 28 EU Member States.
4. Promoting objective knowledge of Esperanto and the culture which it represents. Esperanto was formally recognized as a language of culture by Poland in November 2014, and by PEN International in 1993.
interests: Communication, Culture, Culture and media, Education and training, External Relations, Justice and Fundamental Rights, Research and innovation, Youth
euInitiatives:
1. Multilingualism and improved language learning

2. Strengthening of a common European identity in harmony with national and regional identities

3. Recognition of the culture which Esperanto represents
